rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A logical grouping of [Island]s
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Archipelago
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: Use mso:geography.island_group instead, as this item will not be supported. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:geography.island_group]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A low-lying area that is mostly or wholly surrounded by higher ground.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Basin

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An large body of water that is an inlet of a sea.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bay

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A coast that is covered with sand or fine rock.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Beach

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A body of water is any geographical feature composed of water, including oceans, lakes, rivers, waterfalls, bays, straits and inlets.
Things that are a body of water:
## Oceans, seas, gulfs, and bays (e.g. Pacific Ocean, Baltic Sea, Gulf of Mexico, Bay of Biscay).
## Rivers, streams, brooks, and creeks (e.g. Ganges River, Pleasant Stream, Meers Brook).
## Springs (e.g. Juniper Springs, Deildartunguhver, Tamagawa Hot Spring).
## Waterfalls (e.g. Skogafoss, Humboldt Falls, Aughrabies Falls).
## Lakes, ponds and reservoirs (e.g. Lake Vostok, Lake Fryxell, Rozmberk Pond, Dovestones Reservoir).
## Straits, channels and canals (natural and man-made) (e.g. Strait of Gibraltar, Skagerrak, Rambler Channel, Calbuco Channel, Panama Canal, Canal du Midi).
## Fjords, inlets, and coves (e.g. Flensburg Fjord, Ekmanfjorden, Richard Collinson Inlet, Lulworth Cove).
## Lagoons (e.g. Marovo Lagoon, Vistula Lagoon, Curonian Lagoon).
## Frozen bodies of water (e.g. Lake Bonney, Jackson Pond, Anvil Pond).
## Wetlands, marshes, swamps and bogs (e.g. Okefenokee Swamp, Biebrza Marshes, Strumpshaw Fen, Sifton Bog).
## Bodies of ice that were formed from compacted fallen snow such as glaciers and ice shelves (e.g. Tazlina Glacier, Kaliakra Glacier, Nordre Folgefonna, Ross Ice Shelf).
Things that are NOT a body of water:
## Places situated near bodies of water, such as beaches and bay areas (e.g. Ke???e Beach, Galveston Bay Area, Boston Beach).
## Aqueducts (e.g. Cesse Aqueduct, Pontcysyllte Aqueduct, Mathur Aqueduct). Use mso:architecture.structure for these.
## Man-made structures built on or near bodies of water, such as dams, spillways, and breakwaters (e.g. Three Gorges Dam, Morganza Spillway, Plymouth Breakwater). Use mso:architecture.structure for these.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Body Of Water

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a body of water to a bridge (if any) that spans the body of water.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bridge

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a body of water to its maximum depth in meters.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Maximum Depth

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a body of water to an island in the body of water.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Islands

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a body of water to its average depth in meters.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Mean Depth

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a body of water to the measure of its surface area in square kilometers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Surface Area

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:geography.body_of_water to its tidal range, which is the vertical difference between the high tide and the low tide.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Tidal Range

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a body of water to its total volume of water in cubic kilometers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Volume

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A chamber or system of chambers formed by natural processes that is underground or located in the side of a cliff.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Cave

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a cave or cave system to the number of access points from which the cave or cave system can be entered.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of Entrances

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A landform which outlines the path of a narrow body of water, e.g. a river.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Channel

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A high, steep slope that rises above a landform or body of water.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Cliff

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An area of land adjacent to a body of water, e.g. a river, lake or sea.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Coast

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of points on a compass, namely the cardinal and ordinal points. The cardinal directions are North (N), East (E), West (W), and South (S). The ordinal directions are Northeast (NE), Southeast (SE), Southwest (SW) and Northwest (NW). Depending on the compass used, there may be further divisions.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Compass Point Direction

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A circular or bowl-shaped depression in the earth caused by a volcano or a meteorite.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Crater

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A large area of an ocean where the surface water flows in a constant direction.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Current

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An landform where a river divides into many separate water channels as it enters a large body of water, e.g. a sea or lake.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Delta

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A large area of land with sparse rainfall and little or no vegetation.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Desert

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A basin where rainwater, as well as melting snow and ice, flows into an adjacent or contained body of water, e.g. a river or lake.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drainage Basin

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A hill or series of hills made up of sand.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Dune

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An extended break in the lithosphere.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fault

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A land area that is characterized by dense, uniform tree growth.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Forest

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all natural geographical features. These are the components of a planet, including landforms, ecosystems, bodies of water, and terrain types. Note that this type does not include artificial features and engineering constructs like settlements and roads.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Geographical Feature

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The type of feature that this is: e.g., a mountain, lake, escarpment, cave, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Category
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use the subtypes of geography.geographical_feature to indicate the classification of a landform or body of water. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:geography.geographical_feature to the mso:location.country that claims it or of which it is part. This property can be used to relate the Cotopaxi mountain to Ecuador, the island of Java to Indonesia, and the Mississippi River to the United States.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Country

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a geographical feature to the depth of the feature in meters.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Depth

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a geographical feature to the date, if any, that the feature was first discovered.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Discovered

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a geographical feature to the length of the feature in kilometers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Length

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:geography.geographical_feature to the general direction of the feature's length.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Length Orientation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a geographical feature to the width of the feature in kilometers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Width

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:geography.geographical_feature to the general direction of the feature's width.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Width Orientation
Geographical feature category
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: Use the subtypes of geography.geographical_feature to indicate the classification of a landform or body of water. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: features
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use the subtypes of geography.geographical_feature to indicate the classification of a landform or body of water. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Subcategories of this feature type. For example, subcategories of \"cave\" might include \"sea cave\" and \"lava tube\".
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Subcategories

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A hot spring that intermittently shoots water into the air.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Geyser

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A mass of ice, usually at high latitudes or high elevations, with sufficient thickness to flow away from the source area.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Glacier

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a glacier to a standard classification of its form.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Glacier Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a glacier to its length in kilometers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Length

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a glacier to its current status, viz. whether it is advancing, retreating, or stable.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Status

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a glacier to one of the endpoints of the glacier.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Glacier Terminus

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a glacier to the average thickness of the glacier in meters.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Thickness

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An enumeration of the possible movements of a glacier or, more specifically, a terminus of a glacier, viz. advancing, retreating or stable.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Glacier Status

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The end of a glacier.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Glacier Terminus

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An enumeration of the various forms of glaciers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Glacier Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of harbor types. Harbor types are the classes of harbors. Important sub-classes include natural and artificial harbors, and coastal tide gates, and river basins.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Harbor Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A spring whose water is geothermally heated.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Hot spring

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A large area covered with frozen water
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ice
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This is a state of a body of water, e.g. a frozen lake, rather than a body of water itself. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An area of land completely surrounded by water and smaller than a continent.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Island

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The body of water this island is in.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Body Of Water

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:geography.island to the length of the coastline, the entire length around the island.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Coastline

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: If this island is a member of an archipelago or other group, enter its name.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Island Group

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating an island to a measure, in kilometers, of the length of the island at its longest point.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Maximum Length

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating an island to a measure, in kilometers, of the width of the island at its widest point.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Maximum Width

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A collection of islands that are close to one another and are regarded as a unit.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Island Group

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property relating a group of islands to one of the islands in the group.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Islands In Group

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:geography.archipelago to the mso:geography.island(s) that are considered the maojor islands of the group.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Major Islands

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:geography.archipelago to the total number of islands in the archipelago.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of Islands

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A narrow strip of land connecting two large land masses and bordered by water on both sides.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Isthmus

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An inland body of water, usually containing fresh water.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lake

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a lake to a country that contains, overlaps with, or is adjacent to the lake.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Basin Country

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a lake to the size in square kilometers of the area surrounding the lake from which rain and melting snow and ice flow to the lake.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Catchment Area

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a lake to a city on the shore of the lake.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Shoreline City

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a lake to another body of water that flows into the lake.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Inflow Source

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a lake to a standard descriptor for the type of the lake.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lake Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a lake to the maximum length of the lake in kilometers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Length

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a lake to the number of islands contained by the lake.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of Islands

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a lake to another body of water that flows out of the lake.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Outflow

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a lake to the total length of the shoreline of the lake in kilometers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Shore Length

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a lake to the average height in meters of the surface of the lake above sea level.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Surface Elevation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a lake to the maximum width of the lake in kilometers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Width

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An enumeration of the various classifications of lakes.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lake Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A region of land exhibiting a common characteristic that distinguishes it from surrounding land.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Land area

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A natural geographic feature on dry land.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Landform

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A point on the surface of a celestial body that is the origin for lines of magnetic force.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Magnetic Pole

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A mountain is a large and steep landform that rises high above its surrounding terrain. Although ordinary usage often distinguishes between a hill and a mountain, it is impossible to distinguish the two kinds with precision. Hence, this type includes hills.
Things that are a mountain:
## Hills (e.g. Chocolate Hills, Shouting Hill, Kwabotwe).
## Plateau mountains (e.g. Hunter Mountain).
## Fold mountains (e.g. Mount Robson, Mount Yamantaw).
## Fault block mountains (e.g. Telescope Peak, Mont Donon).
## Volcanoes (e.g. Tyatya, Taal Volcano, Mount Manengouba).
## Undersea mountains and volcanoes (e.g. Bowie Seamount, L????ihi Seamount, Davidson Seamount).
Things that are NOT a mountain:
## Subsidiary peaks of mountains (e.g. Seahpo Peak, Ganalo Peak, Benedict Peak).
## Sea cliffs (e.g. Hangman Cliffs, Tojimbo, Cliffs of Moher).
## Highlands and plateaus (e.g. Tibetan Plateau, Jos Plateau, Shire Highlands).
## Canyons (e.g. McKittrick Canyon, Sumidero Canyon, Ouimet Canyon).
## Mountain passes (e.g. Mont Cenis, Col du Lautaret, Lairig Ghru). Use mso:geography.mountain_pass for these.
## Mountain ranges (e.g. Canadian Rockies, Cordillera Central, Himalayas, Sierra Nevada). Use mso:geography.mountain_range for these.
## Escarpments (e.g. Niagara Escarpment, Bandiagra Escarpment, Usas Escarpment). Use mso:geography.cliff for these.
## Groupings of mountains based on height or prominence (e.g. Catskill High Peaks, New England Fifty Finest, Welsh 3000s, Eight-thousander). Use mso:geography.mountain_listing for these.
## Types of mountains (e.g. dome mountains). Use mso:geography.mountain_type for kinds of mountains.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Mountain
Countries/Sovereign Regions Overlapping the Mountain
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use mso:geography.geographical_feature.country instead, as this item will not be supported. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:geography.geographical_feature.country]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a mountain to the date that someone first climbed to the summit of the mountain.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Date of First Ascent

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a mountain to the vertical distance in meters between the peak of the mountain and sea level. Note that geography.mountain.prominence is another common measure of the height of a mountain.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Elevation
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use mso:location.location.highest_elevation or mso:location.location.mean_elevation instead. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:location.location.mean_elevation]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a mountain to a person who first climbed to the summit of the mountain.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: First Ascenders

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The last time that the mountain erupted. Note that this property should be moved to geography.volcano at some point.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Last Eruption

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a mountain to information about the age of the mountain.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Age of Rock

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a mountain to a list of mountains and hills used in peak bagging. Peak bagging is ascending the highest mountain within a given list.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Listing

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a mountain to the mountain range that contains it.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Mountain Range

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a mountain to a standard descriptor for classifying mountains.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Mountain Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a mountain to the distance in meters between the peak of the mountain and the surrounding area. More formally, it is the vertical distance between the peak and the lowest contour line which circles it and no higher peak. Note that geography.mountain.elevation is another common measure of the height of a mountain.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Prominence

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a mountain to a state or province that is adjacent to, overlaps or contains the mountain.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: State or Province

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about the age of mountains. Note that this type should eventually be deprecated, and its properties should be added directly to geography.mountain.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Mountain Age

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a mountain to its age in years. Note that this property is used only for comparatively young or recent mountains.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Age in Years

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a mountain to the geologic time period in which it was formed. Note that this property is used for comparatively ancient mountains.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Geologic Era

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A list of mountains and/or hills used in peak bagging. Peak bagging is ascending the highest mountain within a given list.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Mountain Listing

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a mountain listing to one of the mountains in the listing.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Mountains

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A break in a mountain range used for transportation from one side to the other.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Mountain Pass

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a mountain pass to the height of the pass in meters.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Elevation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a mountain pass to the mountain range in which the pass is located.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Range

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Any roads that go through this pass.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Transversed By Road

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A group of connected mountains.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Mountain Range

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating a mountain range to the mountain that is the highest peak in the range. Note that the expected type of this property should eventually be changed to mso:geography.mountain.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Highest Peak

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Mountains in this range.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Mountains

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Mountain passes through this range.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Passes

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors to classify mountains, e.g. cinder cone and maar.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Mountain Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person who climbs mountains.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Mountaineer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a mountaineer to a mountain which he or she (alone or as part of a group) climbed to the summit for the first time.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: First Ascents

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An area of vegetation in a desert that is made possible by the availability of water.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Oasis

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that covers the following five large bodies of salt water: the Pacific Ocean, the Atlantic Ocean, the Indian Ocean, the Southern (Antarctic) Ocean, and the Arctic Ocean.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ocean

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A break in a [MountainRange] used for transportation from one side to the other
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Pass

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An elongated area of land projecting into a body of water and surrounded by water on three sides.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Peninsula

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An extensive area of comparatively level to gently undulating land that lacks surface irregularities.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Plain

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A section of the planetary crust that is in motion relative to other tectonic plates.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Tectonic Plate

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An elevated plain with steep slopes on one or more sides.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Plateau

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A point on the surface of a celestial body that marks an important geographical or astronomical location.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Pole

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A small, pointed peninsula whose sides abutting the water are often cliffs.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Promontory

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A partly submerged feature, usually of coral, that projects upward near the water's surface and can be a navigational hazard.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Reef

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all reservoirs or artificial lakes. These are usually to hold water for human use.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Reservoir

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:geography.reservoir to the active capacity of the reservoir in cubic meters. The active capacity of a reservoir is the amount of water that can be drained from the reservoir solely by gravity.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Active Capacity

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:geography.reservoir to the inactive capacity of the reservoir in cubic meters. The inactive capacity of a reservoir is the amount of water that cannot be drained from the reservoir solely by gravity.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Inactive Capacity

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A river is a body of water that flows toward an ocean, a bay, a lake, or another river. This type includes flowing natural and artificial waterways of any size such as rivers, streams, brooks and creeks.
Things that are a river:
## Rivers, streams, and creeks (e.g. Macquarie Rivulet, Arroyo del Medio, Saladillo Stream, Prospect Creek, Bucks Burn, Nant Bran).
## Subterranean rivers, including lost rivers that are only subterranean for part of their length (e.g. Mojave River, Lost River, River Effra, Neglinnaya River).
## Bayous that refer to flowing bodies of water (e.g. Bayou Teche, Bayou des Arc, Bayou Macon).
## Canals (including man-made irrigation, drainage and navigational canals) (e.g. Canalul Oporelu, Alexandra Canal, Great Fergana Canal, Timi??a?? Canal).
## Intermittent or ephemeral bodies of flowing water (e.g. Todd River, Wadi Allaqi, Arroyo Seco Creek).
## Former rivers (e.g. Duwamish River, Harjapea River, Uzboy River).
Things that are NOT a river:
## Estuaries (e.g. Gironde Estuary, Estuary of Bilbao, Dee Estuary) Use mso:geography.body_of_water for these.
## River deltas (e.g. Nile Delta, Ganges Delta, Mississippi River Delta). Use mso:geography.body_of_water for these.
## Waterfalls (e.g. Great Falls of the Passaic River, Iguazu Falls, Orinduik Falls). Use mso:geography.waterfall for these.
# Cutoffs, narrows, rapids, riffles and other things that are only parts of rivers (e.g. Narrows of the Green, Frog Rapids Narrows). Use mso:geography.body_of_water for these.
## Oceans, seas, gulfs and bays (e.g. Atlantic Ocean, Mediterranean Sea, Leyte Gulf, Samborombon Bay). Use mso:geography.body_of_water for these.
## Bodies of water that do not flow, such as lakes, ponds and reservoirs (e.g. Hancza, Brooks Pond, Uglich Reservoir) Use mso:geography.lake for these.
## Aqueducts (e.g. Briare Aqueduct, Lune Aqueduct, Monocacy Aqueduct). Use mso:architecture.structure for these.
## Fictional and mythological rivers (e.g. Styx, Cocytus, River Sirion). Use mso:fictional_universe.setting for these.
## Navigable waterways that include or pass through some rivers as part of their route (e.g. Elizabeth River and Halifax River are part of the Intracoastal Waterway). Use mso:geography.body_of_water for these.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: River

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a river to the size in square kilometers of the area surrounding the river from which rain and melting snow and ice flow to the river.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Basin Area

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a river to a country that contains, overlaps with, or is adjacent to the river.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Basin Country

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a river to a state that contains, overlaps with, or is adjacent to the river.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Basin State

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a river to a city that contains, overlaps with, or is adjacent to the river.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: City

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a river to a the average amount of water in cubic meters per second that moves through the river.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Average Discharge

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a river to the total length of the river in kilometers from origin to mouth.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Length

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a river to the body of water into which the river flows, e.g. a sea or river.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Mouth

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a river to the average height in meters of the mouth of the river above sea level.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Mouth Elevation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a river to information about the longitude and latitude of the river's mouth.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Mouth

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a river to the geographical feature from which the river flows.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Origin

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a river to information about the longitude and latitude of the river's origin.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Origin

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a river to the average height in meters of the origin of the river above sea level.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Origin Elevation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Any large body of salt water.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Sea

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A body of water that flows to the surface from underground.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Spring

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all surf breaks. These are the obstructions on the seabed that cause an ocean wave to break against the shore.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Surf Break

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The shared edge between two tectonic plates.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Tectonic Boundary

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A landform that is either a tectonic plate or a boundary between tectonic plates.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Tectonic Feature

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A geographical feature that is under water.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Underwater Feature

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A low area surrounded by higher ground on two or more sides.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Valley

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An area of the earth's crust where volcanoes are likely to arise.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Volcanic Field

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A mountain formed by a volcanic eruption or a series of volcanic eruptions.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Volcano

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a volcano to the volcanic field where the volcano is located.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Volcanic Field

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A vertical or very steep section of a River where the water cascades.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Waterfall

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a waterfall to the number of vertical sections that make up the waterfall.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of Drops

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The average amount of water, in cubic meters per second, that flows over the waterfall.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Average Flow Rate

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a waterfall to its height in meters.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Total Height

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a waterfall to the height in meters of its longest drop (the longest vertical section making up the waterfall).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Height of Longest Drop

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a waterfall to a standard descriptor for the classification of the waterfall.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Waterfall Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An enumeration of the various classifications of waterfalls.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Waterfall Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An area of high soil moisture, partially or intermittently covered with shallow water.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Wetland
